Free-to-play games network Lootcakes has raised $2 million in a seed funding round.

"At Konvoy, our investment focus is to support founders with the pursuit of improving the gaming industry. description: Bridge, a UK-based company that enables merchants to add, remove or bundle payment services, snagged £2.5m in funding from Gloag Investment Group.

description: BukuKas, the Indonesian provider of digital ledger technology to small businesses, netted $9m of pre-Series A funding in a round joined by Saison Capital, Surge of Sequoia Capital India, Speedinvest, January Capital, Cambium Grove Capital and S7V.

description: Centi, a Switzerland-based startup enabling Bitcoin SV payments via point of sale terminals, announced it raised an undisclosed amount of new capital led by Jürg Conzett, founder of Zurich’s MoneyMuseum, and technology entrepreneur Calvin Ayre.

description: Moov Financial, the Cedar Falls, Iowa-based provider of an open-source platform for embedding banking services within applications, raised $5.5m in a seed round led by Bain Capital Ventures, with participation from Canapi Ventures, Commerce Ventures, Gradient Ventures, RRE Ventures, Uncorrelated Ventures and angels.

description: Kin Insurance, the Chicago-based home insurance technology firm, bagged $35m in Series B financing with Commerce Ventures in the lead and participation from Hudson Structured Capital Management (doing its reinsurance business as HSCM Bermuda), Flourish Ventures, QED, Alpha Edison, Allegis NL Capital, Avanta Ventures (an arm of CSAA Insurance Group, a AAA Insurer), August Capital, the University of Chicago via its Startup Investment Program, and others.

description: The Demex Group, a Washington, DC-based climate risk insurtech focused on creating offerings that target the intersection of insurance and banking, raised $4.2m in seed funding from Anthemis and IA Capital Group. description: Kin Insurance, the Chicago-based home insurance technology firm, bagged $35m in Series B financing with Commerce Ventures in the lead and participation from Hudson Structured Capital Management (doing its reinsurance business as HSCM Bermuda), Flourish Ventures, QED, Alpha Edison, Allegis NL Capital, Avanta Ventures (an arm of CSAA Insurance Group, a AAA Insurer), August Capital, the University of Chicago via its Startup Investment Program, and others.

Existing investors including Ribbit Capital, Atomico and Mosaic Ventures also participated

description: Blend, a San Francisco-based digital lending solution provider, has secured $75m in Series F funding led by Canapi Ventures, with participation from existing investors Temasek, General Atlantic, 8VC, Greylock, and Emergence. The round increases Blend's valuation to nearly $1.7bn, according to a company press release.

description: Raises (Global) SuperSim, a São Paulo-based micro-enterprise lender, raised approximately $5.7m in debt financing which it will use to “reinvent Brazil’s credit market,” Contxto reported.

description: Trumid, a New York-based bond trading platform, has raised $200m in a round that now values the company at more than $1bn, according to a Bloomberg report. Dragoneer Investment Group led the round which also included TPG as well as funds and accounts managed by T. Rowe Price Associates and BlackRock. FT Partners advised Trumid on the financing.

description: Chia Network, a San Francisco-based startup whose distributed platform has yet to launch and which aims to unseat Ethereum as the network of choice for DeFi apps, raised $5m in equity capital led by Slow Ventures. The company was founded in 2017 and has raised total venture funding to date of $17m, according to CoinDesk.
header: Chia Network Raises $5M to Rival New Crop of DeFi-Friendly Base Layers

description:
Local venture capital heavyweight Airtree Ventures has led a $3.1 million investment in insurance technology startup Open, as it tips the insurance sector to be the next battleground for digital disrupters.

"Insurance is a sleeping giant that's ripe for disruptive players," Airtree partner James Cameron said.

"It’s crazy that an industry this big has seen so little digital innovation. I’m absolutely convinced that we’ll see more and more disrupters in this space build very big businesses and Open is one of a few that are at the forefront of this."
header: Airtree leads $3.1 million investment in insurance platform Open

description: Routable, a San Francisco-based B2B payments startup, inked $12m in Series A funding from a group of investors that included Y Combinator, Founders Co-Op, and Box Group.

description: RevenueCat, the San Francisco-based startup that helps companies set up the subscriptions infrastructure for mobile apps, raised $15m in Series A funding led by Index Ventures

description: Till, an Alexandria, Virginia-based startup enabling renters to be able to pay a portion of their rent each time they get paid, rather than on the first of the month, and which also offers rental loans, bagged an $8m seed round led by Route 66 Ventures with participation from MetaProp Ventures and NextGen Venture Partners.

description: The Blockchain ecosystem after the hype
header: More than six months have passed since our last update on the Crypto Ecosystem map that gathered a whopping 18.9 thousand views on Medium alone and much has happened. Bitcoin has peaked at $20,000 and then collapsed to $6,000, leaving us with a tough lesson — there is no fast and easy way for everyone to get rich. The storm has calmed down; the industry and its community have matured, introducing new sensible ideas and rebuilding the blockchain world on the site of broken dreams. That’s why we feel like it is a great time to refresh our map. The industry evolves, and so does our diagram, we have decided to reshape it using additional logic and structure.

description: Zurich, Switzerland and Copenhagen, Denmark - The Swiss digital health engagement platform company dacadoo and Liva Healthcare, an innovative digital health coaching platform for disease management, announce a strategic cooperation. dacadoo’s platform focuses on health promotion of the healthy and at-risk populations, while Liva Healthcare focuses on specific disease conditions with its disease management coaching platform. description: why the cryptocurrency Blox
header: Blox, formerly known as CoinDash, describes itself as the ‘next generation platform for portfolio tracking and blockchain asset management’. The product enables automatic synchronisation of wallets and exchanges into one account.Blox offers “Virtual trading, Multi wallet & exchange automated sync, manual trading, watch-lists, alarms, cross-device compatibility and more”.
publication: Blox, formerly known as CoinDash, describes itself as the ‘next generation platform for portfolio tracking and blockchain asset management’. The product enables automatic synchronisation of wallets and exchanges into one account.Blox offers “Virtual trading, Multi wallet & exchange automated sync, manual trading, watch-lists, alarms, cross-device compatibility and more”.  The company announced their rebranding from CoinDash to Blox on 27.2.18, however the ticker name of their traded token remains http://CDT.In the future (expected Q2 2018) the product will include social features and will integrate use cases for their token (CDT) in the platform. The token will give the users the options to watch accomplished traders and their portfolio strategies. Users will be able to replicate experienced traders ‘in a simple, interactive, collaborative environment’. On the other hand, users will be able to earn CDT by giving a public display of their of their personal portfolio and trading activities.  The product is available on iOS, Android and Web.  Links:Android: https://play.google.com/store/ap... iOS: https://itunes.apple.com/il/app/blox-io/id1331004654?mt=8 Web: https://app.blox.io Support Email: support@blox.io

description:
Competitive analyses are extremely important to B2B marketing strategies. They help to identify weaknesses as well as highlight where you’re having success against your competitors.

To put it simply: If you’re not measuring your performance against that of your peers, you’re falling behind the competition.
When starting a B2B competitive analysis, it can often seem overwhelming. It’s often a struggle to identify comparable competitors and metrics as well as sift through the mountains of data. So much information, so little time, amiright?

It’s because of this that I’ve put together a list of the 5 most important things (IMO) to pay attention to.

1. What is your competition’s overall domain authority?
A great place to start on your competitive analysis is with domain authority. The domain authority numbers can give you a high level view of where you stand against the competition.

Domain authority basically summarizes the overall “authority” of a site.

In the example below, I used Moz, which rates websites from 0-100 with 100 being the best. Of the 5 different websites I plugged in, Moz automatically identified the highest, which in this example was Apple.com.
header: 5 Things to Pay Attention to in a B2B Competitive Analysis
